subject: Relationships
title: Fighting Fair: Rules of Engagement
description: A quick win: understand Fighting Fair: Rules of Engagement.

hook.text: Couples who fight by rules stay together longer than couples who avoid fighting altogether.

buildup.text: Fair fighting rules: no name-calling, no bringing up the past, no 'always' or 'never' statements.

discovery.text: Therapists teach 'I-statements' to shift blame into vulnerability: 'I feel hurt' instead of 'You hurt me.'

twist.text: The goal of a fair fight isn't to win â€” it's to understand. The moment someone wins, both people lose.

climax.text: Conflict is inevitable. Cruelty is not. How you fight reveals more about your love than how you celebrate.

punchline.text: Couples who fight fair stay longer than those who don't fight at all.

quiz.question: What is the goal of a 'fair fight' in a relationship?
